channel.title: Deleting objects within a certain area

item.title: Deleting objects within a certain area
item.dc:creator: @oron oron
item.description:
@oron wrote:

Ahh thanks for the help, I tried my way. It worked pretty nearly apart from the fact when server started it disconnected me about 5 times. Runs stable then. But then theres the problem of the trees still showing on minimap and for a pking area it’s actually pretty annoying. So I’ll go find somewhere else

EDIT: Oh btw if anyone knows of any good enclosed places for a pk area then please say.

Read full topic
item.source: Deleting objects within a certain area

item.title: Deleting objects within a certain area
item.dc:creator: @x_m_1_k_3_x x m 1 k 3 x
item.description:
@x_m_1_k_3_x wrote:

You can try creating a class file that loads deleted objects through a XML file. Example…

<object>
/* 
 * @Starts the XML file
 */

<delete>
ID
ID
ID
ID

/*
 * @Put all deleted objects here.
 */

</delete>

<replaceObj>

/*
 * @All replaced Objects here...
 */

</replaceObj>

</object>

Make the XML file load like that, I don’t know how to create XML files, but that should be an example of how to do it

Read full topic
item.source: Deleting objects within a certain area

item.title: Deleting objects within a certain area
item.dc:creator: @oron oron
item.description:
@oron wrote:

Ok so I’ve finally found a decent place for a pk area, but it’s covered in trees! Now I know how to delete objects, but to do it for every single tree It would take forever. So is there a way to delete objects within a certain area? I’ve though of one way, a loop of some sort.

for(x = 2627; x < 2675; x++) {
    for(y = 3473; y < 3503; y++) {
        deletethatobject(x, y);
    }
}

That would probably lag the hell out of the server though, seen as each x loop it does it does 30 y loops :S.

Anyone has a better way?

Read full topic
